name: vslilypond
description: Provides syntax and error highlighting, compilation on save, MIDI (input and playback) support for LilyPond in VSCode.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Play (from start)
commands.description: Play MIDI from the start. You can also use the `Play MIDI` button on the left of the status bar. MIDI Playback device is set using `VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Set output device` command.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Play from...
commands.description: Play MIDI from a user-input timestamp. You can also use the `Play MIDI from...` button on the left of the status bar.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Stop
commands.description: Stop MIDI playback. You can also use the `Stop MIDI` button on the left of the status bar.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Pause
commands.description: Pause MIDI playback. You can also use the `Pause MIDI` button on the left of the status bar.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Resume
commands.description: Resume MIDI playback. You can also use the `Play MIDI` button on the left of the status bar.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Set output device
commands.description: Set workspace-folder specific MIDI output device for playback. You can also change this manually (for more scopes) in settings under `Vslilypond › Midi Playback: Output`.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Input: Start MIDI input
commands.description: Start MIDI Input. You can also use the `Start MIDI Input` button on the right of the status bar. MIDI input device is set using `VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Set input device` command.`

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Input: Stop MIDI input
commands.description: Stop MIDI Input. You can also use the `Stop MIDI Input` button on the right of the status bar.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: MIDI Input: Set input device
commands.description: Set workspace-folder specific MIDI input device for input. You can also change this manually (for more scopes) in settings under `Vslilypond › Midi Input: Input`.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: Compile
commands.description: Compiles a main lilypond file (if specified in settings). Otherwise, compiles the currently active lilypond file. (Use VSLilyPond: Compile this specific file` to compile the currently active file). See settings under `Vslilypond › Compilation` for additional settings.

commands.title: VSLilyPond: Compile this specific file
commands.description: Compiles the currently active lilypond file. Use `VSLilyPond: Compile` to compile a main file if specified in settings.

vslilypond.general.pathToLilypond.description: Path to `lilypond` executable. Default (`lilypond`) assumes lilypond is in PATH variables.

vslilypond.intellisense.enabled.description: Displays errors as you type. Disable to improve performance. Reload required.

vslilypond.compilation.compileOnSave.description: Compiles file upon saving. Disable to improve performance. Reload required.

vslilypond.compilation.compileMainFileOn.description: If true, compiles main file set in `Vslilypond › Compilation › Path To Main Compilation File`, else, compiles the currently active file.

vslilypond.compilation.additionalCommand.description: Additional command line arguments supplied to `lilypond` upon compilation. Note that `--loglevel=WARNING` is predefined. Intellisense also uses these arguments.

vslilypond.compilation.pathToMainCompila.description: Relative path (from workspace folder root) of the file to compile when a document in a folder/workspace is saved. If none specified, the current active file is compiled.

vslilypond.midiPlayback.output.description: MIDI Device used for output. If none specified, the first valid device is used. You can use the command `VSLilyPond: MIDI Playback: Set output device` to select a device from a list.

vslilypond.midiInput.input.description: MIDI Device used for input. If none specified, the first valid device is used. You can use the command `VSLilyPond: MIDI Input: Set output device` to select a device from a list.

vslilypond.midiInput.chordMode.description: Chord mode in music entry. Registers notes that are pressed and held together as a chord instead of sequential notes.

vslilypond.midiInput.relativeMode.description: Relative mode (as opposed to absolute mode).

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run test && npm run compile && npm run lint && npm run generateDocs
scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
